Sentencas: This study is one component of a two-part paper aiming to investigate the feasibility of directly feeding renewable liquid biofuels in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Investigation of Direct-Fed Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Fueled by Upgraded Bio-Oil Extracted from Olive Waste Pyrolysis: Part 1: Bio-Oil Characterization and Preliminary Cell Testing

Sentencas: In part 1, we examined changes that occur in the physicochemical properties upon upgrading process via catalytic esterification of fast pyrolysis crude bio-oil and we preliminary analyzed and compared the influence on the power outputs of SOFCs.
Titulo: Investigation of Direct-Fed Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Fueled by Upgraded Bio-Oil Extracted from Olive Waste Pyrolysis: Part 1: Bio-Oil Characterization and Preliminary Cell Testing

Sentencas: Upgraded bio-oil was characterized revealing that all acid groups present in the crude bio-oil were totally converted to esters.
Titulo: Investigation of Direct-Fed Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Fueled by Upgraded Bio-Oil Extracted from Olive Waste Pyrolysis: Part 1: Bio-Oil Characterization and Preliminary Cell Testing

Sentencas: The H/C ratio increased while the O/C ratio decreased upon upgrading.
Titulo: Investigation of Direct-Fed Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Fueled by Upgraded Bio-Oil Extracted from Olive Waste Pyrolysis: Part 1: Bio-Oil Characterization and Preliminary Cell Testing

Sentencas: Upgraded bio-oil composition is comprised mostly of aliphatic groups (60 %) followed by saturated methyl esters (30 %).
Titulo: Investigation of Direct-Fed Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Fueled by Upgraded Bio-Oil Extracted from Olive Waste Pyrolysis: Part 1: Bio-Oil Characterization and Preliminary Cell Testing

Sentencas: Upgraded bio-oil viscosity (2.78 cP), neutrality (pH approximate to 7) and energy density (40.94 MJ kg(-1)) were considerably enhanced.
Titulo: Investigation of Direct-Fed Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Fueled by Upgraded Bio-Oil Extracted from Olive Waste Pyrolysis: Part 1: Bio-Oil Characterization and Preliminary Cell Testing

Sentencas: SOFC electrochemical performance results are promising showing that current density increases by 1.7 and approximate to 2 times while peak power density increases by 1.6 and 3 times upon upgrading at 700 degrees C and 750 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Investigation of Direct-Fed Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Fueled by Upgraded Bio-Oil Extracted from Olive Waste Pyrolysis: Part 1: Bio-Oil Characterization and Preliminary Cell Testing
